a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Contribution to global mean surface temperature rise by gas, World, 1851 to 2021
The global mean surface temperature change as a result of a country or region's cumulative emissions of three gases –
carbon dioxide, methane, and nitrous oxide.
Data source: Jones et al. (2023). National contributions to climate change due to historical emissions of carbon dioxide, methane and nitrous
Note: This does not include cooling impacts from sulphur dioxide and aerosols, so the net warming can be lower.
